website_summaries.verdict: A luxurious shaving cream for those with sensitive skin and anyone who wants to be pampered.
pros: Can be used in the company's four-step process or alone
Softens hair and renders a smooth shave
cons: Some buyers say the quality has gone down over time

customer_reviews.title: Actual shaving cream is fine, but bottom 1/3 of the container is fake and doesn't hold any product.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the scent, liked how it works for shaving, hated the false bottom 2/3 of the way down inside a container that's obviously (now that I've opened it) designed to look like it holds more product than it really does.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. McGiblets

customer_reviews.title: Other reviewers are right...Product quality has diminished over time.
customer_reviews.text: Have used the product for years and have been disappointed in my last several jars....no longer has the thickness or scent it used to have. As other reviewers have indicated, the cream was MUCH thicker previously and now it is similar to whipped cream. The scent also has diminished considerably over the years. You can still get a good shave if you use almost double the amount of cream (otherwise I would given one star). I recently used an old travel tube and the difference was striking and confirmed all of my suspicions. Sadly, this will be my last jar and I will start looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why did it have to change???
customer_reviews.text: This was my favorite shaving cream. I used it for several years. Then, it changed. Why? It was so good! Now, the scent has a strange chemical undertone. And it has lost its slickness. I had some serious issues with irritation and had to send it back. Oh well, I guess I’ll have to rely on TOBS shaving creams now.
customer_reviews.author: runnerguy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, smooth, concentrated, luxurious...
customer_reviews.text: People must just love to complain. The negative reviews for this product are either from people that are never satisfied or from people wanting to harm this particular brand. Smells amazing. Lathers like a dream. Uses small amount per shave. No irritation. Smooth as silk shave. Shave daily? It will last a long time if you understand you don't need more than a quarter in diameter and thickness per shave - and that is actually more than I use. I use half that much. Also, don't use lots of water while lathering. Use very little water. Gradually add water if necessary. Use a brush and a shaving/lathering bowl. Happy Shaving!
customer_reviews.author: H. Sears

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This shaving cream was not the same texture and consistency as the one I bought previously. Maybe it was a dud but I did notice it had a 1 year older manufacturer date then the same shaving cream that I bought today at their retail store. This one was not usable! I will never buy this shaving cream on Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: What happened? This used to be such a great shaving cream, but no more. It still lathers well, so it doesn’t get a single star across the board, but I will not buy it anymore. Sandalwood? Not even close. It smells like a bar of soap, or even laundry detergent, but not sandalwood. It arrived so gummy and dry that I had to add water to the jar before I could scrape any out. It is almost the consistency of shaving soap, not shaving cream. I am really disappointed. I guess it’s back to TOBS again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kosh

customer_reviews.title: Best shaving cream ever
customer_reviews.text: Best shaving cream ever! Silky smooth, great lather, such a small amount goes along way! Once you use this you will never want to use another shave cream. While I was waiting for my re order of this product to arrive I used edge which I used to think of as good, now I realize it is horrible compared to this product My fiancée bought this for me for Christmas 2015 I shave my face and head everyday and just ran out in September. So if your thinking the 25 bucks is steep do the math!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shaving cream!
customer_reviews.text: Discovered this shaving cream about a year ago after decades of having difficulty shaving. The Art of Shaving system is the only thing I have ever used that does not cause my face to break out in horrible, painful bumps. This shaving cream specifically lasts a very long time; you only need a small amount on a brush to get good coverage. The scent is light enough to not be bothersome in any way, yet good enough for my wife to absolutely love it after I shave.
customer_reviews.author: James Grantham

customer_reviews.title: Lathers like CRAZY
customer_reviews.text: Art of Shaving shave cream is a staple of my daily routine. This stuff lathers like crazy, stays moist forever, and seems to lubricate my skin to prevent nicks, cuts, and razor burn. When used with a badger shaving brush a very small amount is required to provide two shaves ( I always shave twice, first with the grain of my beard, second against the grain) which is what "The Art of Shaving" recommends. I have tried some of the "Shave Club" products and they don't measure up to The ART of Shaving shave cream
customer_reviews.author: Jerryjohn22

customer_reviews.title: The Best, and a jar last forever
customer_reviews.text: The product is hands down the best I have used. Never going back to a spray cream. VERY concentrated, and a tiny bit is sufficient for a shave. A dime sized dab is way more than enough, and it can be stretched forever. Yes, the container is much smaller on the inside than out, and that is a little disappointing to see that trick, but the amount is what is on the label, and a jar last about 6 months (shaving 5x a week, heavy beard). The smell is great, just enough to be really nice in the morning, and it provides a smooth shave. I haven't found anything better.
customer_reviews.author: BCC

customer_reviews.title: Great shave cream!
customer_reviews.text: I shave my head, but I never shaved it every day, because it was too tough on my scalp. Now I use the Sandalwood, Art of Shaving line, and I love it. I use the essential oil, followed by a steaming hot towel, then just a dab of the shaving cream at the bottom of my bowl makes a phenomenal hot lather with the brush and hot water. I end with the hydrating lotion, and I do not get razor burn, or skin irritation. It smells great, and I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Fredstrong

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best shaving cream
customer_reviews.text: I love this shaving cream, a little goes a long way, and the results are a super smooth shave, without irritation The only downside is that my wife found out how awesome this shaving cream is so I run out of it quicker than anticipated, so my tip to you, is enjoy this quietly :D I did try the unscented at one point and was not a fan, I guess you need the scent to cover the base smell of the ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Ofer Bezalel

customer_reviews.title: Lathers up beautifully and smells great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my husband but his reviews are definitely thumbs up. He says it lathers up really nice and Im a sucker for that scent!! I think its a little pricy but you do get a lot and the jar does last him a long time. So maybe its not as pricey if you divide up into the months use you get out of one jar. And the scent like i said is just dreamy, very manly. I'll follow him anywhere after using this Sandalwood scented shaving cream!! The Art of Shaving does a really good job with the scent.
customer_reviews.author: Janice B

customer_reviews.title: New (lame) formulation for 2019- at this price point, go elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2018; great scent, dense texture until on the brush. Bought in March 2019, no scent, more like Fluff than anything else. Just awful. Two stars because I've yet to cut myself when using it. Otherwise, it would be one star, because it's no different than generic unscented.
customer_reviews.author: C. tucker

customer_reviews.title: A great cream with some cavetes.
customer_reviews.text: The cream is a bit thin compared to English Shave Creams. You'll use about 3x more per shave then it's much thicker counterpart. That said it provides good lift and the sent is fantastic. I don't shave every day so this is a great product for me. Daily shavers might want to look into Castle Forbes Cedarwood & Sandalwood Essential Oil Shaving Cream, possible the bet shaving cream on the planet. Don't be daunted by the price, it'll last about a year with daily shaves. That said if your not a daily shaver, or if you just love a strong manly smelling cream, then you can't go wrong with this big corporate product (Proctor and Gamble).
customer_reviews.author: J.M.N.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, smooth shave
customer_reviews.text: Love this shaving cream, and if you use it right it can last you almost the whole year, I'd give this item 10 stars if I could, I received a swap gift at Christmas a few years ago from a family member, that was a trial package of this product. Believe it or not I have been hooked on it ever since, my wife even uses it now on her legs, she says it's the smoothest her legs have ever been, with both of us using it, it's been about 3 months on this bottle and it's still over 3/4 of the way full.. Great smell, and smooth shave..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cream
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good cream and smells great and works good but I still prefer Taylor of Old Bond Street. The container it came in looked like there was a lot of cream but it seems to have like a false bottom. The container isn’t as deep on the inside as it was on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: John F Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Its good but old formula was better
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the original formula. They original formula you could use the tiniest amount and it would cover your entire face in a thick coat. This version you have to use more and it doesn't give as thick of a coat. It's still a great product but they obviously made a cheaper version which runs out quicker so they can make more money. Next time I need to rebuy might try another brand. It would have been more willing to pay more for the old product over the newer one. It's still a good product but not as good as the original.
customer_reviews.author: C. Roditis

customer_reviews.title: Seems as good as from the store
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought art of shaving products from their actual store before, and this product is of the same quality. I looked at some reviews before buying that said this product is of lower quality. Amazon has had a lot of problems with fake products, but this one seems legit. It is also cheaper than buying from the actual store in person. This shaving cream has a good sandalwood scent and gives a good shave.
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: This cream with a light oil is the best. Smooth skin minimal irritation and ingrown
customer_reviews.text: I have an Art of Shaving store about 20 minutes away. The product from Amazon is exactly the same. I have ingrown hair and razor burn issues. This cream with a light oil is the best. Smooth skin minimal irritation and ingrown. I use a double sided safety razor and crew oil. Better than the other 30 some odd products and razors ive waisted money on. Makes Dollar Shave Club cream and butter seem like garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shave cream
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shaving cream. Just a very small amount on your fingertip lathers up luxuriously after adding water and rubbing your hands together. Of the fragrances I’ve tried, this is how I’d rank them: 1. Lavender (herbal, fresh, like the real plant) 2. Peppermint (refreshing, cooling) 3. Sandlewood (smells like old-time barbershop in a good way)
customer_reviews.author: Lone Star

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Arts of Shaving Cream.
customer_reviews.text: I have using this product for months now and it seems to last forever. It seems like a small container but it has lot of shaving cream volume. Use pre shaving oil in conbination with shaving cream. The sandalwood smell isnt really there, or better yet not overpowering. The after shave(if you have one) has a better smell.
customer_reviews.author: Atif Yasin

customer_reviews.title: Thre best quality shave cream ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have used several kinds of shave creams and I keep coming back to this brand. It is a very high quality cream so you don't have to use much for each shave. I swirl my brush a couple of times and it provides enough lather to shave twice. Before I came back to this brand, my face was breaking out in a rash. Within a few days of using this shave cream, the rash was gone. I also notice that I don't get any nicks. Forget the cheaper ones, this will save you in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moseley

customer_reviews.title: The Art of Shaving
customer_reviews.text: Great product and use along with pre-shave oil. Very clean, close, comfortable shave. Use in the shower or out. Don't need much as a little goes along way. I use nothing but The Art of Shaving products as I think they are the best to give the best results. Obviously, it would be better if not so pricey but I think you get what you pay for. If you are going to shave everyday, might as well be comfortable and get a clean shave at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Complexion After A Month
customer_reviews.text: My husband religiously uses Art Of Shaving products, including this shave cream. Before he started using Art Of Shaving, his completion was ruddy and red. After using products for about a month, his skin became smooth and soft. I highly recommend Art Of Shaving products as they have made a difference in my husbands life.
customer_reviews.author: San Ramon

customer_reviews.title: This stuff smells and performs amazing and will last forever.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic cream! This stuff smells amazing, is very slick, and a little goes a VERY long way! This traditional shaving cream will probably stretch farther than almost any other traditional shaving cream out there. Manly scent, but a good balance between old and new school in terms of scent. This tub will probably last me years.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron King

customer_reviews.title: Nice smooth shaving, attractive scent... Not fruity, not all Macho either!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a straight razor and old single blade screw down safety razors on my legs and underarms for years I recently switched over to a Mens Gillete ProGlide, yellow strip, triple blade model but kept my Art of Shaving, Sandalwood and my badger brush I was also a fan of Taylor's of Old Bond Sreet Sandalwood twin packs but they were outrageously priced this month what with the Covid inflation factor. If you enjoy "whipped" creamy shave soaps, this one's a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy §Simply_Sara

customer_reviews.title: Costs more, but I think it is worth it. It is by far the best.
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this to any other cream I have tried. The lather is fast and thick. It costs almost double compared to my second favorite cream, but then a jar lasts for so long, that only means a few pennies a day. I think I will stick with this brand now. It's just so good. I use a steel bowl and a synthetic brush.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey the Barak

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: After I purchased this product I gave it a five star review. In the past, this shaving cream REALLY smelled like sandalwood, so much so that most times I did not even bother to use aftershave. Well, I stand corrected, unfortunately. I got this in the mail (see pic) and from the cheap label I thought something was up. Sure enough, after shaving twice I have come to the unsavory conclusion that THIS is not the advertised product. It is a scentless shaving cream with a cheap label that reads "sandalwood" instead. Will not buy again!
customer_reviews.author: G. Stucco

customer_reviews.title: Product has a gummy texture.
customer_reviews.text: This product is worthless. It *should* be called, "shaving gum". The gummy texture makes it next to impossible to run a blade through it, efficiently. I won't be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Art of Shaving is THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best! Don't let the price put you off from buying. I used to buy shave gel at the local chain store for a little under $4 bucks a can. It would last me a few weeks, and I would go buy some more. The Art of Shaving shaving cream lasts me for at least eight months. Just a little (and I do mean a LITTLE) on my fingertips applied to my wet face goes a very long way, and I shave almost every day. This gives me a super-close shave and leaves my face feel refreshed and soft. Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: A Man of Low Degree

customer_reviews.title: Keeping Classic Shaving Alive
customer_reviews.text: Using a brush and this type of shaving cream is a great way to stimulate the hair follicles in your beard so they stand up and shave easier. I've had all the supplies and accessories for years and have recently returned to using this type of shave cream. The Art of Shaving are quality products and have a great scent.
customer_reviews.author: BOC in PS

customer_reviews.title: The best Sandalwood Shaving Cream on the market
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion the best shaving cream on the market. It is expensive but worth the extra cost. A small amount goes a long way. Using the right silver tip badger brush, a steel mixing bowl and just the right amount of warm water in the brush creates a perfect lather. A little practice on the amounts and you get a great shave every time. This is a very smooth and wonderful smelling shaving cream. I use AOS Sandalwood exclusively.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: My boyfriend loves it. And I love the smell!
customer_reviews.text: Smells amazing, only need a little for a full face shave. Smells amazing, none irritating to the skin as my boyfriend has sensitive skin. A much better alternative to the bars that can collect bacteria and usually have to be thrown out half way though due to rust or bacteria that breaks out the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Not good and too thick
customer_reviews.text: It was very thick and had to add drops of water to it to make it work. But getting the consistency I wanted was very difficult to get right each shave and honesty not worth the effort even if it was awesome which it was not. It's was easily the worst shaving cream I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome smell and awesome cream!
customer_reviews.text: I've been interested in the Art of Shaving products for a while and finally decided to take the plunge. I bought this along with the shave oil of the same scent. Yes it does seem a bit pricy for shave cream, but a little goes a long way. I wet my brush and dab it down into the jar and get a small sized amount. It lathers up super thick and is more than enough for a couple passes. I could easily see this lasting for several months or more. When used in conjunction with the shave oil I got the best and closest shave I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Great scent. Nice lather.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shave cream. Just a light dip with a shave brush and it lathers for both the with-the-grain initial shave, and the against-the-grain final shave, and leftover for any finishing touches. The scent is fantastic too.
customer_reviews.author: JustAConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Old school perfection
customer_reviews.text: After a year of trying other products: "New" "Improved" "All natural" "Vegan" "Kosher" I decided to come back... And I'm glad I did: Great lather Awesome fragrance Rinses right... Try it once!
customer_reviews.author: pJackson

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best-scented shaving creams for men, in my view. The scent is sexy, yet clean and mild. I've purchased this several times as gifts and each recipient has asked me where they could purchase it again. Highly recommend this item. High quality and nice packaging.
customer_reviews.author: SkyRiderAZ

customer_reviews.title: Rich lather, great smell, moisturized skin.
customer_reviews.text: Leaves a smooth, moisturized skin after the shave. Pleasant smell, though I would have liked it to smell a little ‘fresher’. I was using Taylor of Old Bond Street Sandalwood before this. This certainly feels ‘richer’. The smell is different, may be a touch of oil and aloe vera? Needs small quantity on the brush for rich lather. This is going to last me at least 3 months and I’m a daily shaver. Will recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mohit

customer_reviews.title: Best Cream I've Used
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shaving cream. It has a nice texture and a subtle scent. Of all the varieties I've tried, I like this one the best. I will be reordering when the time comes (which should be a while, it seems to last a long time as only a small amount on the brush lathers up my whole face).
customer_reviews.author: Tomcat

customer_reviews.title: Great smell and lather!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my boyfriend to start using safety razors to save money on blades after we stopped subscribing to dollar shave club. I like that you don’t necessarily need that fancy badger brush to agitate it into a fine foam. He loves the woodsy smell of sandalwood and so do I.
customer_reviews.author: Chinadoll

customer_reviews.title: and Amazon had the best price. It is well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My husband shaves his face and head. This is the only shaving cream he will use now. His skin feels soft, and his shave lasts longer. I compared prices at several places, and Amazon had the best price. It is well worth the money. It takes much less if this cream to shave Tha it does other shaving creams and gels, so it lasts much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Shaving at its finest...  Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: The best shave cream I have ever tried. This is the first time I purchased this product with a scent. I usually buy unscented, but I liked the packaging color. I was very surprised how subtle the fragrance is. Will definitely buy again. When using, remember that a little goes a long way!
customer_reviews.author: XenRN

customer_reviews.title: Very good, very comfortable and very expensive
customer_reviews.text: Very good, very comfortable and very expensive. I have a very light beard and only shave every two or three days. I always have the one I am using and one in reserve. I also use the pre shave oil, the balm and talc. Soft as a babies bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. I have sensitive skin and have tried dozens of shave creams. Even the sensitive ones irritate my skin. Finally this place idiocy allows me to get a close shave shutout irritating my skin and leaves no razor burn.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Kara

customer_reviews.title: Best shaving cream
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite shaving cream. It smells amazing and is gentle on the skin. I live in a very humid area and it helps keep me from breaking out. I use it daily and it does last me about 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy W.

customer_reviews.title: Best Shave!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT product! For years (all 77), I have been searching for the perfect shave, and I have finally found it. First, apply a thin (correct, thin) coating of Shave Smart Caffeinated Shaving Cream. Then, with an old-fashioned shaving brush (also sold by the Art of Shaving, and you don't have to buy the most expensive one) , work up a lather of Art of shaving cream. I use a two blade razor, and Feather blades are the sharpest. They are not that expensive, so you can throw the blade away after two shaves. ENJOY!
customer_reviews.author: Guy K. Stewart, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Aweful aweful.. I would get a more comfortable shave using hot water and the claws of an alley cat. Clogged my razor, required numerous strokes compared to “cheap” creams. Smelled bad and felt cheap. Terrible product !
customer_reviews.author: nicky

customer_reviews.title: I've found better, this is really expensive
customer_reviews.text: I've found better, this is really expensive, also, every tub I have bought (now 3) is inconsistent. I've since bought a few other creams and they do not have this problem. They are also in tubes rather than tubs, I suspect that has something to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product... I can't always afford the time to do it right, but when I can...: post shower, soak thick hand towel in hot (hot as I can stand it) water. Use genuine badger hair brush to work up good lather and apply healthy amount to beard. Lightly wring out towel and hold on face (over lather) for at least 1 minute... longer if you can. Then re lather again and shave with new blade (I'm not man enough to use a straight razor). Smells great.
customer_reviews.author: WyoWill

customer_reviews.title: Smells nice.
customer_reviews.text: While it smells great, lathers easy, is super slick, it dried my skin horribly. It did yield a close shave but after rinsing I felt like I was outside all day on a cold and windy day. Product that costs this much should not produce such horrible results. I have used a number of soaps with, Tabac, Razorock, Prorasso, Mitchel's Wool Fat, PAA, Stirling, and Barbasol. All are far superior to this. I hope the burning stops soon.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shave cream
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful texture and richness when applied to the skin with the use of AoS's pre shave oil. Allows for smooth shaving and minimal irritation or pulling. Great for sensitive skin. The smell is masculine without being overbearing. The container tends to last me about 3 months with application every 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M

customer_reviews.title: Nice lather but...
customer_reviews.text: Nice lather but they seem to have changed the formula, not as fragrant as last one -
customer_reviews.author: Dr WHO

customer_reviews.title: P&G ruined this brand
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good scent Lathers well Cons: 1/3 of container is a fake bottom Quality has gone down in years Proctor and gamble bought them years ago, so it will continue to get worse but stay a "premium" price
customer_reviews.author: G. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Is this a knock off?
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this is simply not the same as the previous shaving cream I bought directly from Art of Shaving. Possibly they have cheapened this product, and possibly this is a counterfeit. Cremo is far better than this. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg George

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Lathers great... smells and works well.. I go back and forth with this and the proraso so this will last years :) a little goes long ways.. I will use less next shave cause it lathers fast and used too much first time also lol
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting jar, good scent from afar
customer_reviews.text: What's to say... the smell of sandalwood and shaving cream that lasts a year or so... 5 stars!! Disclaimer: I use a small dab on a badger hair brush, spread it around and straight edge it... each of these canisters have lasted a year! So long, canned gel shaving cream at $7 a can which last 1 - 1.5 months.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Never buy again
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Art of Shaving Sandalwood shaving cream I have purchased. This one is not as the others. It is usually a luxurious cream, but this one is more of a solid substance. It does not lather as well as the others. In fact, it is difficult to break down the substance to make lather. It seems as if I purchased a cheap shaving cream. Not what one expects from the Art of Shaving. I tried it again this morning and found it difficult to build a lather. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: lee kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Same quality as Art of Shaving store.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what all these people are talking about regarding the quality of this item. I've used the Art of Shaving products for about a year and a half now and they are great products. I just ran out of my shaving cream so I ordered it on Amazon to save the trip to the Art of Shaving store. Rather product is The same as you buy in the store. Very pleased with purchase. Will buy from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Despite trying multiple brands over the years, this continues to be my go-to. Sensitive skin and daily shaving for the military means a quality shave cream is a must.
customer_reviews.author: daniel grady

customer_reviews.title: Simply The Best
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is fantastic. I use it to shave with a straight razor and it performs better than anything I've bought at Walmart or Walgreens. And the smell is addicting. The best of anything I've used in any respect. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: One of the very best..
customer_reviews.text: This is a pricey but truly exceptional shaving cream. It has a great fragrance, great latherability, perfect consistency, and lubricates the skin well. One tub lasts for quite awhile too, as you only need maybe one teaspoon per shave.
customer_reviews.author: JCO

customer_reviews.title: Makes shaving waaaayyyy better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband years ago to make his shaving experience more luxurious. He won’t shave without it he loves it so much. I think it smells amazing!
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Lasts a long time (A little goes a long way) - Revitalizing scent - Smells great! - Easy to Use (as opposed to shaving soap) - You feel sophisticated using it Cons: - A bit pricey Overall, yes, I would recommend this product.

product_meta.title: The Art of Shaving Shaving Cream,Sandalwood
product_meta.description:
The Art of Shaving Shaving Cream softens and lifts the beard for a close and comfortable shave, and protects the skin from irritation and razor burn. How to Use-For a closer shave, re-lather and shave lightly across or against the grain. Rinse with cold water and apply After-shave Balm. Using Hot Water. Water/Aqua, Palmitic Acid, Myristic Acid, Stearic Acid, Potassium Hydroxide, Coconut Acid, Glycerin, Triethanolamine, Fragrance/Parfum, Sodium Chloride, Sodium Hydroxide, Lauric Acid, Propylene Glycol, Tetrasodium Edta, Disodium Edta, Phenoxyethanol, Methylisothiazolinone, Coumarin, Hexyl Cinnamal, Alpha-Isomethyl Ionone.
